#### The purpose of this pyspark notebook is to read Delta tables from owb_standarsied_db to owb_harmonisied_db and load all records as Delta tables along with metadata columns.

**Author**               **Created Date**              **Description**  
Rohit Shukla         04-Mar-2025             The functionality of this notebook is to Delta Table transform_inspector_address into owb-harmonisied_db                                                                 layer. Following stored procedures have been reverse engineered from MiPiNS using these stored prcedures :                                                                 1. [Build].[sap_employee_hierarchy]          2. [Build].[dim_employee_hierarchy] and function   
                                                                3. [Live].[udf_sap_LineManagement_H]

**Spark Cluster Configuration** -> Apache Spark Version- 3.4, Python Version 		- 3.10, Delta Lake Version 	- 2.4

# Define delta table names, database name and table paths
source_database_name = "odw_standardised_db"
target_database_name = "odw_harmonised_db"
source_delta_table = f"{source_database_name}.inspector_addresses_weekly"
target_delta_table = f"{target_database_name}.live_dim_emp_hierarchy"
delta_table_path = f"abfss://odw-harmonised@{storage_account}saphr/live_dim_emp_hierarchy"

employee_df = spark.sql("""SELECT  PersNo,
        Firstname,
        Lastname,
        PersNo1
        FROM odw_harmonised_db.load_sap_hr_monthly""")

# Anchor: top-most employees (no manager)
current_level = employee_df.filter((col("PersNo1").isNull()) | (col("PersNo1") == '00000000'))\
    .withColumn("EmpLevel", lit(1))

all_levels = current_level
level = 1

while True:
    # Try to fetch next level
    next_level = employee_df.alias("e").join(
        current_level.alias("r"),
        col("e.PersNo1") == col("r.PersNo")
    ).select(
        col("e.PersNo"),
        col("e.Firstname"),
        col("e.Lastname"),
        col("e.PersNo1"),
        (col("r.EmpLevel") + 1).alias("EmpLevel")
    )

    new_rows = next_level.subtract(all_levels.select("PersNo", "Firstname", "Lastname", "PersNo1", "EmpLevel"))

    if new_rows.count() == 0:
        break # We've reached the bottom

    level += 1
    current_level = new_rows
    all_levels = all_levels.union(new_rows)

max_depth = level
print(f"Max hierarchy depth = {max_depth}")

anchor_df = sap_df.filter((col("PersNo1").isNull()) | (col("PersNo1") == '00000000')).join(email_df, "PersNo").select(
        sap_df["PersNo"],
        sap_df["Firstname"].alias("FirstName"),
        sap_df["Lastname"].alias("LastName"),
        sap_df["PersNo1"].alias("ManagerNo"),
        lit(1).alias("EmpLevel"),
        email_df["email_address"]
    )

cteReports = anchor_df
current_level = anchor_df

# Simulate recursion
for _ in range(max_depth):
    next_level = df_sap.alias("e").join(
        current_level.alias("r"),
        col("e.PersNo1") == col("r.PersNo")
    ).join(
        df_email.alias("em2"),
        col("e.PersNo") == col("em2.PersNo")
    ).select(
        col("e.PersNo"),
        col("e.Firstname").alias("FirstName"),
        col("e.Lastname").alias("LastName"),
        col("e.PersNo1").alias("ManagerNo"),
        (col("r.EmpLevel") + 1).alias("EmpLevel"),
        col("em2.email_address")
    )

    if next_level.subtract(cteReports).isEmpty():
        break

    cteReports = cteReports.unionByName(next_level).dropDuplicates()
    current_level = next_level

cteReports.createOrReplaceTempView("cteReports")

#display(cteReports)

# Load Live.sap_employee_hierarchy equivalent for hierarchy building
df_sap = cteReports.alias("r").join(df_sap.alias("mgr"), col("r.ManagerNo") == col("mgr.PersNo"), "left").join(email_df.alias("emgr"), col("mgr.PersNo") == col("emgr.PersNo"), "left").selectExpr(
        "r.PersNo as PersNo",
        "r.FirstName",
        "r.LastName",
        "r.ManagerNo",
        "r.EmpLevel",
        "r.email_address",
        "mgr.PersNo as ManagerPersNo",
        "mgr.Firstname as ManagerFirst",
        "mgr.Lastname as ManagerLast",
        "emgr.email_address as ManagerEmail"
    ).withColumn("FullName", concat_ws(" ", col("FirstName"), col("LastName"))).withColumn("Manager", concat_ws(" ", col("ManagerFirst"), col("ManagerLast")))


df_sap = df_sap.withColumn("FullName", concat_ws(" ", col("FirstName"), col("LastName"))) \
       .withColumn("Manager", concat_ws(" ", col("ManagerFirst"), col("ManagerLast")))

df_sap = df.selectExpr(

    )

# Start with each employee as their own anchor
anchor_df = sap_df.selectExpr("persno as orig_emp_id").distinct()

# Join to build a full flattened hierarchy for each employee using iterative approach
all_hierarchy = None
current_level = anchor_df.join(df_sap, anchor_df.orig_emp_id == df_sap.persno).selectExpr(
        "orig_emp_id",
        "persno as emp_id",
        "FullName as emp_name",
        "email_address as emp_email_address",
        "managerno as mgr_id",
        "Manager as mgr_name",
        "EmpLevel as mgr_level",
        "ManagerEmail as mgr_email_address",
        "'' as hierarchy"
    )

all_hierarchy = current_level
max_depth = 10

for _ in range(max_depth):
    next_level = current_level.alias("h").join(
        df_sap.alias("s"),
        col("h.mgr_id") == col("s.persno")
    ).select(
        col("h.orig_emp_id"),
        col("s.persno").alias("emp_id"),
        col("s.FullName").alias("emp_name"),
        col("s.email_address").alias("emp_email_address"),
        col("s.managerno").alias("mgr_id"),
        col("s.Manager").alias("mgr_name"),
        col("s.EmpLevel").alias("mgr_level"),
        col("s.ManagerEmail").alias("mgr_email_address"),
        lit("").alias("hierarchy")
    )
    
    all_hierarchy = all_hierarchy.unionByName(next_level).dropDuplicates()
    current_level = next_level

# Add row numbers to get the lowest-level emp info for each original employee
window_spec = Window.partitionBy("orig_emp_id").orderBy(col("mgr_level").desc())

df_ranked = all_hierarchy.withColumn("rn", row_number().over(window_spec))

# Normalize: keep the lowest-level employee's name/email, and final manager info
window_spec2 = Window.partitionBy("orig_emp_id")

df_normalized = df_ranked.filter("mgr_level > 1").withColumn("emp_name", min_(when(col("rn") == 1, col("emp_name"))).over(window_spec2))     .withColumn("emp_email_address", min_(when(col("rn") == 1, col("emp_email_address"))).over(window_spec2)).withColumn("hierarchy", lit("SAP")).withColumn("mgr_level", col("mgr_level") - 1).selectExpr(
        "orig_emp_id as emp_id",
        "emp_name",
        "emp_email_address",
        "mgr_id",
        "mgr_name",
        "mgr_level",
        "mgr_email_address",
        "hierarchy"
    ).dropDuplicates()

# Final output schema matches expected file: includes mgr_id and hierarchy
sgl_df = spark.sql("""
    SELECT 
        E2.PersNo AS emp_id,
        CONCAT(E2.Firstname, ' ', E2.Lastname) AS emp_name,
        I2.pins_email_address AS emp_email_address,
        E.PersNo AS mgr_id,
        CONCAT(E.Firstname, ' ', E.Lastname) AS mgr_name,
        1 AS mgr_level,               
        I.pins_email_address AS mgr_email_address,
        CONCAT('Chart (', I.resource_code, ')') AS hierarchy
    FROM odw_harmonised_db.live_dim_inspector I2 
    INNER JOIN odw_harmonised_db.load_vw_sap_hr_email E2 ON I2.pins_email_address = E2.email_address
    INNER JOIN odw_harmonised_db.live_dim_inspector I ON I2.resource_code = I.resource_code AND I.is_sgl = 1
    INNER JOIN odw_harmonised_db.load_vw_sap_hr_email E ON I.pins_email_address = E.email_address
    WHERE I.is_sgl = 1 AND I.active_status = 'ACTIVE' AND I2.is_sgl = 0
""")


# Final output sorted in descending mgr_level = closest at top
df_final_dim_hierarchy = df_normalized.unionByName(sgl_df.select(df_normalized.columns)).dropDuplicates()


rowid_columns = [c for c in df_final_dim_hierarchy.columns if c not in {"SourceSystemID","IngestionDate","ValidFrom","ValidTo","RowID","IsActive"}]

df_final_dim_hierarchy = df_final_dim_hierarchy.select(

    col("mgr_level").cast("string").alias("mgr_level"),

    current_date().cast("timestamp").alias("ValidTo"),
    md5(concat(*[coalesce(col(c).cast("string"), lit("")) for c in rowid_columns])).alias("RowID"),
    lit("Y").alias("IsActive")
    )

df_final_dim_hierarchy = df_final_dim_hierarchy.select(
col("emp_id"),
col("emp_name"),
col("emp_email_address"),
col("mgr_id"),
col("mgr_name"),
col("mgr_level"),

display(df_final_dim_hierarchy)
